TNF inhibition has revolutionized the treatment of several rheumatic diseases since the late 1990s. When it comes to HBV infection, however, TNFα is an important cytokine to assist in the eradication of the virus from the liver. Low levels of TNFα have been associated with reduced cytotoxic CD8+ responses against HBV and TNFα neutralization may favor HBVr.
